citations.narrative:
The facility obtained two litters of puppies in 2022 (six Corgi puppies and seven Bassett Hound puppies) from breeders
who are not licensed under the Animal Welfare Act and not a pound or shelter. The facility did not obtain a certification
that the animals were born and raised on the person's premises and that the person has sold fewer than 25 dogs that
year for research, teaching or testing purposes. The facility did have a verbal discussion with the breeder about these
topics but did not obtain written certification. Written certification is necessary as documentation to verify that the
person/breeder is exempt from licensure requirements under the Animal Welfare Act. If dogs or cats are acquired from
any person not licensed under the Act and not a pound or shelter, the facility must obtain a certification that the animals
were born and raised on the person's premises and that the person has sold fewer than 25 dogs and/or cats that year for
research, teaching or testing. Correct by 4/28/23.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The outdoor exercise yard (D1) is in need of repair:
*A broken plastic gate is lying in the ground just inside the entrance to the yard. Dogs running and playing in the yard may
injure themselves on the broken plastic pieces.
*The yard itself has numerous deep (up to 12in deep) holes ranging in circumference from approximately four to eighteen
inches in the ground. Some of the smaller holes are obscured by grass and not easily visible. It appears from digging
marks that an animal has been making the holes. Dogs running in the yard may step into a hole accidentally and injury
themselves.
Premises including the grounds must be kept clean and in good repair to protect the dogs from injury. The exercise run
needs to be repaired. Correct by not allowing dogs access to the exercise yard D1 until it is repaired and by 9/30/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with manager and other facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.35(b)(8) 
   
Recordkeeping requirements. 
The facility obtained two litters of puppies in 2022 (six Corgi puppies and seven Bassett Hound puppies) from breeders 
who are not licensed under the Animal Welfare Act and not a pound or shelter. The facility did not obtain a certification 
that the animals were born and raised on the person's premises and that the person has sold fewer than 25 dogs that 
year for research, teaching or testing purposes. The facility did have a verbal discussion with the breeder about these 
topics but did not obtain written certification. Written certification is necessary as documentation to verify that the 
person/breeder is exempt from licensure requirements under the Animal Welfare Act. If dogs or cats are acquired from 
any person not licensed under the Act and not a pound or shelter, the facility must obtain a certification that the animals 
were born and raised on the person's premises and that the person has sold fewer than 25 dogs and/or cats that year for 
research, teaching or testing. Correct by 4/28/23. 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The outdoor exercise yard (D1) is in need of repair: 
*A broken plastic gate is lying in the ground just inside the entrance to the yard. Dogs running and playing in the yard may 
injure themselves on the broken plastic pieces.

*The yard itself has numerous deep (up to 12in deep) holes ranging in circumference from  approximately four to eighteen 
inches in the ground. Some of the smaller holes are obscured by grass and not easily visible. It appears from digging 
marks that an animal has been making the holes. Dogs running in the yard may step into a hole accidentally and injury 
themselves.  
Premises including the grounds must be kept clean and in good repair to protect the dogs from injury. The exercise run 
needs to be repaired. Correct by not allowing dogs access to the exercise yard D1 until it is repaired and by 9/30/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with manager and other facility representatives. 
 
 n
